intro: Chlorocrambe hastata, commonly known as the narrowleaf bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairie and steppe habitats. Chlorocrambe hastata is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
